bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Wah Ni for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
State of Washington, County of Pierce
Charlie Hing being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:-

That he has been a resident of Portland, Oregon for three years last past, and that prior to that time he resided at the City of San Francisco in the State of California for over ten years; and that he did, in the month of June, 1890 come to Port- land and buy into and obtain an interest in the firm of Yee Wah Co., of which Wah Ni was at the time and still is a member, said company being dealers in Chinese and Japanese fancy goods at number 254 Morrison Street in said City of Portland, and that said Wah Ni now has an interest to the extent of $1000 in said firm, said deponent having an interest of $1500; that he is well and personally acquanited with said Wah Ni, and knows that on the 11th of January, 1892, the said Wah Ni left the city of Portland for China, with the intention of there making a visit with his relatives and also to ascertain the newest paterns and styles and prices of goods and make arrangements for buying same for said firm; that it was the rule and custom of said firm for the said re- spective partners to in turn return to China for that purpose; that it was the turn and desire of said Wah Ni to return to China and that he did leave on or about the aforesaid date and returned or attempted to return about one year from that date; that this deponent as partner of said Wah Ni did come to Tacoma to appear before the United States court to identify said Wah Ni and to prove the facts as recited in his said petition for a writ of ha- beas corpus, all of which statements of the said Wah Ni are true to deponent's own knowledge, and deponent hereto attaches a card

of his said firm of which said Wah Ni is a member as aforesaid, and deponent further says that said Wah Ni is a good, honest and bona fide merchant of the United States and has been for more than three years last past and deponent knows that he is a joint owner of the business as aforesaid and still a member of said firm.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Residing at Tacoma, Washington.
